messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Just say no (was Digest Number 957)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/30/03 9:04:07 PM, OomYaaqub@aol.com writes:  We all know there are
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/30/03 9:04:07 PM, OomYaaqub@... writes:

<< There is no contradiction between unschooling
and worksheets! >>

We all know there are worksheets available on the internet, and every
bookstore, toystore, grocery store and Walmart have workbooks.

This list isn't intended for dissemination of worksheets.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Just say no (was Digest Number 957)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 07/30/2003 11:46:47 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Both my kids actually enjoy worksheets/workbooks, if they can do them when THEY want to.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 07/30/2003 11:46:47 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


>
>
>
>
>
>
> 600 printable worksheets thumbnails!?????
>
>
> GROSS!!
>
> The internet is full of printable worksheets.
> Let them rest in peace.
>

Both my kids actually enjoy worksheets/workbooks, if they can do them when
THEY want to. One advantage to them is that they allowed self-paced work. I
basically taught myself all of highschool-level precalculus math in a few months
using self-paced workbooks. There is no contradiction between unschooling
and worksheets!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Just say no (was Digest Number 957)
messages.msgSnippet: 600 printable worksheets thumbnails!????? GROSS!! The internet is full of printable worksheets. Let them rest in peace.
messages.messageBody:
600 printable worksheets thumbnails!?????


GROSS!!

The internet is full of printable worksheets.
Let them rest in peace.
